message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Bank Enterprise Survey on entrepreneurs in sub-Saharan Africa in the last decade and integrates it with United Nations Development Programme's Gender Development Index to assess the relationship between gender and entrepreneurship.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey", "United Nations Development Programme's Gender Development Index"], "topic": ["Gender", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze household survey data collected by the Malawi National Statistical Office and data on weather patterns from the Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data to understand the impact of climate change on the crop yields and labor supply of smallholder farmers.", "dataset": ["Malawi National Statistical Office household survey data", "Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This paper investigates the effect of financial inclusion initiatives on poverty reduction by using a panel dataset comprising of World Bank's Global Findex and household surveys from developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Global Findex", "household surveys from developing countries"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from World Bank's Logistics Performance Index, International Air Transport Association's Market Analysis Team and United Nations Conference on Trade and Development's Liner Shipping Connectivity Index to evaluate the competitiveness of air transport in African countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Logistics Performance Index", "International Air Transport Association's Market Analysis Team", "United Nations Conference on Trade and Development's Liner Shipping Connectivity Index"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Transport"]}, {"sentence": "We combine consumer price index data provided by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies with data on energy consumption patterns from the French Environment and Energy Management Agency to investigate the impact of carbon taxes on consumer behavior in France.", "dataset": ["National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies' consumer price index data", "French Environment and Energy Management Agency's energy consumption patterns"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes the Global Health Data Exchange's malaria prevalence data and WorldPop's population distribution maps to identify regions with high vulnerability to malaria in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Global Health Data Exchange's malaria prevalence data", "WorldPop's population distribution maps"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "We use panel data from the National Survey of Firms conducted by the Mexican Statistical Institute, Mexican Firm Productivity and Competitiveness Survey and Mexican manufacturing plants dataset to investigate the role of labor market regulations on firm productivity and competitiveness in Mexico's manufacturing sector.", "dataset": ["National Survey of Firms conducted by the Mexican Statistical Institute", "Mexican Firm Productivity and Competitiveness Survey", "Mexican manufacturing plants dataset"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines the relationship between extractive industries and conflict using a unique dataset that combines the Uppsala Conflict Data Program's armed conflict database and the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative's revenue transparency data.", "dataset": ["Uppsala Conflict Data Program's armed conflict database", "Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative's revenue transparency data"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "To analyze the factors that influence urbanization patterns and their effect on social inequality, we use urbanization and income inequality data from the United Nations Human Settlements Programme and World Bank's World Development Indicators dataset for a panel of developing countries.", "dataset": ["United Nations Human Settlements Programme's urbanization and income inequality data", "World Bank's World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "We use the Demographic and Health Surveys conducted in Zimbabwe between 2010 and 2016 and data on nutrition outcomes from the Global Nutrition Report to evaluate the effectiveness of Zimbabwe's public nutrition policies.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys conducted in Zimbabwe between 2010 and 2016", "Global Nutrition Report's data on nutrition outcomes"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Public-Private Partnerships"]}]
